hackathon-judges.judge-role: Executive VP and Chief Experience Officer, Planned Parenthood

hackathon-eligibility: At least one participant representative from a team must be present to demo in-person at the Science Fair Demo Day and Finals on September 25th to be eligible to win.
hackathon-rules:
At least 1 representative from your team must be physically present to demo in-person at the Science Fair Demo Day at Grindr HQ in Los Angeles on Sep 25, 2016.
1. Demos must be functional demos: no slideshows/pure design mockups.
2. Every single participant must be registered on both Eventbrite (hack4equality2016.eventbrite.com) and Devpost because that’s what we’re using for submissions/judging.
3. Teams can have up to 5 members.
4. Be excellent to each other. <3
 
Note: There will be media/press at the events; participation in the hackathon and/or workshops implies consent to the use of your likeness in Hack4Equality/Grindr/HackerNest videos.
Secondary note: Grindr, HackerNest, and Hack4Equality will not be responsible for or involved in any dispute resolution exercises (ownership, shareholders agreements, IP, etc.) for teams. We suggest you sort these matters out before participating.
 
Hack4Equality is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, previous hackathon attendance or computing experience (or lack of any of the aforementioned). We do not tolerate harassment in any form. Hackathon participants violating these rules may be expelled from participation at the discretion of the hackathon organizers.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: +Mercury, a high-stakes public affairs firm with 18 offices around the world – including Los Angeles, San Francisco, and New York City – will provide one month of pro-bono consulting services to each of the category winners, plus an additional month for the grand prize winner. Associated value of $15,000 per category winner and $30,000 for the grand prize winner.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: $3500 Challenge Set Winner: International LGBTQ Issues
$3500 Challenge Set Winner: Access to Sexual Health Services & PrEP
$3500 Challenge Set Winner: Transgender Awareness & Economic Empowerment
1-hour consultation with Terrence Yang of Yang Ventures
1-hour mentorship lunch with Joel Simkhai, Grindr CEO
1-hour mentorship lunch with Paul Grossinger and David Beatty of Gaingels Syndicate

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A special Runner-Up prize was created by our Finals Judges last minute because of how difficult it was to award just one Grand Prize! Thank you to Grindr and Planned Parenthood for generously pooling the resources to make this happen!

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=750 N San Vicente Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How will this improve the lives of your beneficiaries?
How easily does this fit into people's lives; is it adoptable?
How well put-together is the project; the team?
